alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Iron (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 18 at 4:01PM CST until February 18 at 4:15PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CST FOR IRON AND SOUTHERN ASHLAND COUNTIES... At 400 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 9 miles northwest of Bessemer, to near Gile, to 8 miles southeast of Mellen, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes US Highway 2 from near Odanah to Hurley and Wisconsin State Road 77 between Mellen and Hurley. Locations impacted include... Hurley, Mellen, Saxon, Gurney, Upson, Gile, Montreal, Kimball, Morse, Pence, Van Buskirk, Bad River Reservation, Gile Flowage, Cedar, Franks Field, Island Lake Iron County, High Bridge, Iron Belt, Birch Hill, and Copper Falls State Park. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
